DOC.brief_summary: IncobotulinumtoxinA ( Xeomin ) botulinum toxin type A preparation free complexing protein , i.e . free protein active toxin . Injected muscle , incobotulinumtoxinA ( Xeomin ) cause local weakening . Botulinum toxin type A widely use treatment various neurological condition . This study investigate efficacy safety incobotulinumtoxinA ( Xeomin ) treatment post-stroke spasticity upper limb .
DOC.brief_title: IncobotulinumtoxinA ( Xeomin ) Versus Placebo Treatment Post-stroke Spasticity Upper Limb
DOC.criteria: Main Female male patient ≥ 18 year ≥ 6 month since last stroke , diagnose appropriate health care professional ( e.g. , neurologist ) Focal spasticity ≥ 2 point Ashworth Scale wrist flexor clinical pattern Flexed Wrist Focal spasticity ≥ 2 point Ashworth Scale finger flexor clinical pattern Clenched Fist For pretreated patient : source documentation recent injection session Botulinum Toxin sufficient therapeutic response Flexed Wrist Clenched Fist For pretreated patient : recent injection Botulinum Toxin must maximal 50 Units BOTOX® 200 Units Dysport® 2000 Units Neurobloc® ( type B preparation ) per flexor : carpus ulnaris , digitorum superficialis , digitorum profundus For pretreated patient : recent injection Botulinum Toxin must maximal 60 Units BOTOX® 240 Units Dysport® 2400 Units Neurobloc® ( type B preparation ) flexor carpus radialis Main Spasticity origin stroke Previous treatment Botulinum Toxin serotype body region within 4 month prior Screening ( Visit 1 , Day 7 ) Planned concomitant treatment Botulinum Toxin serotype body region Previous plan treatment phenol alcoholinjection target limb Previous surgical treatment spasticity target muscle ( ) Fixed contracture , define severe restriction range joint movement passive stretch Severe atrophy target limb muscle
